pros: State benefits and decent pay

pros: Friendly atmosphere and laidback work environment

pros: Students are wonderful, good teaching and learning environment

review_title: Learn how to Lead a Group!
pros: Great experience working for this part of the school. Good learning opportunity to learn how to be a leader of a group.
cons: Only problem with working with the school is the scheduling. Schedules revolved around class schedule.

job_title: Assistant Director of Career Development in Bloomsburg, PA
pros: Good benefits, unionized, work with students, most people are friendly.
cons: State institution, funding tied to politics

review_title: Collegial environment, but issues in administration
pros: Faculty are generally very collegial, and are usually willing to help each other out. Student interest in education varies, but most seem genuinely motivated to learn and succeed.
cons: Administrative decisions are extremely difficult to predict. This is partly a product of administration not being transparent with faculty. This is very frustrating for faculty who do their best to provide students with a top-quality education.

review_title: Provided growth and skills needed for employment
pros: Allowed me to work on real projects, and gave me valuable experience that I could apply toward a job in the field.  It was helpful that we actually went out and met with clients, and I worked with another student which gave me skills in that regard.
cons: Could have given me more hands on technical experience, more personalized feedback, etc.  Also we should have been paid more since we worked on real projects with clients.

pros: Great Atmosphere, Opportunity for Growth, Allows freedoms and leadership Opportunities. I would recommend working here. They make sure you get what you need.
cons: Can occasionally be disorganized and hectic. Sometimes misleading, overall a good employer! Having worked for them for almost all of college, it is worthwhile..

pros: A very flexible position for college students. It is a very friendly work environment, and you will grow as a student, an individual, and a professional with the skills you will learn in the Admissions Office
cons: You will miss this job very much after you graduate! Can be hard to schedule between classes/clinicals if your schedule is tricky.

review_title: My experience with working with bloomsburg has been unbelievable with the great atmosphere and faculty/staff members l.
pros: The best reasons for working here is for the non stop ability to build connections and a great dynamic community.
cons: The one challenge is the struggle to find the proper parking spot to be able to access the appropriate building.

review_title: A comfortable work environment for entry-level employment.
pros: Supportive staff and enjoyable work environment, well-rounded experience and skills, convenient for enrolled students, develops experience in library service and customer service.
cons: For a student position, you are only allotted 20 hours per week under the library assistant work-study position. Employment concludes upon graduation unless promoted to a full-time staff position.

pros: small community, easy to get around.  friendly town. Growth is possible. Atmosphere is aiming towards that of a research facility
cons: small community, Nepotism is very apparent. Jobs are on a who you know. Focus is not always on the students or with their best interest in mind.

pros: Flexibility in scheduling own class times, time off in between semesters is lovely as well as the summers, good insurance, great atmosphere
cons: Pay is very low, I made several thousand dollars more teaching for the public school system. Parking is atrocious, I usually end up walking a few blocks to my office every day.

pros: Gave me the ability to lead a small group in discussions. Overall, one of the most valuable experiences I have ever had.
cons: It was rather difficult to get find information about becoming a part of the tutor program.  It took me some time to find out who was in charge of hiring.

pros: Covers Cost of Tuition. Gives you a small paycheck on the side to help pay your bills. Allows you to get a masters degree without accumulating significant additional debt (if any)
cons: The stipend is not enough to cover off-campus housing.
